Method Detail

canProvideStatements

Cache.StatementSourceAssurance canProvideStatements(SubQuery subQuery,
                                                    Endpoint endpoint)
Ask the cache if a given endpoint can provide results for a subQuery. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement. Subset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, c, c} brings results, hence also S2:={?x, ?y, c} will provide results. This method can be used to test this and will return HAS_STATEMENTS. Superset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, ?y, c} brings results, hence S2:={?x, c, c} may provide results. This method will return POSSIBLY_HAS_STATEMENTS in such a case.

Parameters:
subQuery -
endpoint -
Returns:
NONE -> the cache knows that endpoint cannot provide any results HAS_LOCAL_STATEMENTS -> the cache has local statements (highest priority) HAS_REMOTE_STATEMENTS -> the cache knows that endpoint does provide results POSSIBLY_HAS_STATEMENTS -> if the endpoint is not known or in case of superset inference

hasLocalStatements

java.util.List<Endpoint> hasLocalStatements(SubQuery subQuery)
Ask the cache if it can provide results for a subQuery for any endpoint. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement. Subset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, c, c} has local results. However, cache will pessimistically assume that S2:={?x, ?y, c} has no local results as we cannot assure that the complete data is available locally. Hence, this method will return false. Superset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, ?y, c} has local results, hence S2:={?x, c, c} has local results as well as the cache maintains a superset of the requested results. In such a case this method will return true.

Parameters:
subQuery -
Returns:
the endpoints for which local data is available, an empty list otherwise

hasLocalStatements

boolean hasLocalStatements(SubQuery subQuery,
                           Endpoint endpoint)
Ask the cache if it can provide results for a subQuery for the specified endpoint. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement. Subset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, c, c} has local results. However, cache will pessimistically assume that S2:={?x, ?y, c} has no local results as we cannot assure that the complete data is available locally. Hence, this method will return false. Superset inference: Cache knows that S1:={?x, ?y, c} has local results, hence S2:={?x, c, c} has local results as well as the cache maintains a superset of the requested results. In such a case this method will return true.

Parameters:
subQuery -
Returns:

getCacheEntry

CacheEntry getCacheEntry(SubQuery subQuery)
Retrieve the CacheEntry instance matching the specified subQuery. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement.

Parameters:
subQuery -
Returns:
the CacheResult or null (if no match was found) - read only clone!

getStatements

info.aduna.iteration.CloseableIteration<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement,java.lang.Exception> getStatements(SubQuery subQuery)
Retrieve an Iterator containing the results for the given subQuery. If no match is available locally an empty iterator is returned. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement.

Parameters:
subQuery -
Returns:
an iterator, possible empty if no data is available locally

getStatements

info.aduna.iteration.CloseableIteration<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement,java.lang.Exception> getStatements(SubQuery subQuery,
                                                                                                                 Endpoint endpoint)
Retrieve an Iterator containing the results for the given subQuery for the given endpoint. If no match is available locally an empty iterator is returned. Note that S1:={?x, c, c} and S2:={?y, c, c} are treated as the same statement.

Parameters:
subQuery -
Returns:
an iterator, possible empty if no data is available locally

updateEntry

void updateEntry(SubQuery subQuery,
                 CacheEntry merge)
                 throws EntryUpdateException
Update the given entry using a merge procedure: Data present in the original is overwritten, if not present it is simply added. Note that data not touched in the specified merge structure will remain as is.

Parameters:
subQuery -
merge -
Throws:
EntryUpdateException
